metadata.title: CVE-2015-5314 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The eap_pwd_process function in eap_server/eap_server_pwd.c in hostapd 2.xbefore 2.6 does not validate that the reassembly buffer is large enough forthe final fragment when used with (1) an internal EAP server or (2) aRADIUS server and EAP-pwd is enabled in a runtime configuration, whichallows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (process termination)via a large final fragment in an EAP-pwd message.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5314` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hostapd - 1:2.1-0ubuntu1.4
wpagui - 2.1-0ubuntu1.4
wpasupplicant - 2.1-0ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wpa package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1-0ubuntu1.4').
wpa package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1-0ubuntu1.4').
